guide.introduction: One of my friends is a fan of the Green Lantern, and he thought it would be cool to have a glowing ring that charges when put inside a lamp. I realized that I already had something similar in my Upgraded Indestructible LED Lantern project, so I decided to build it.
guide.introduction_rendered:
One of my friends is a fan of the Green Lantern, and he thought it would be cool to have a glowing ring that charges when put inside a lamp. I realized that I already had something similar in my Upgraded Indestructible LED Lantern project, so I decided to build it.

Relevant parts
  • 1.5A power supply, between 6V and 12V
  • Wireless sender (step 1 of one of my other guides "Upgraded Indestructable Led Lanterns"
  • About 10 ft of magnet wire, 28awg
  • High brightness green LED
  • Tiny 3.6V rechargable battery (I got mine from a broken toy helicopter)
  • Green LED 3mm
  • Capacitor, at least 0.001uf
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 1 1/2" x 1 1/2" Tee
  • PVC 2" coupling, female, threaded-slip
  • *optional* accurate green lantern ring replica for modification
  • Tiny slide microswitch
Tools
  • Glue (must work with plastic)
  • Paintbrush
  • Soldering Iron and rosin core solder.
  • Wire cutter/stripper
  • knife, drill, or hacksaw

lines.text: First, build the wireless charger from step one of Upgraded Indestructible LED Lanterns. Make sure to follow all the directions, or you will fry your transistors.

The ring pictured was thrown together after I had already given the real one to my friend and realized that I had not taken any pictures of it for this guide.  The one I gave him was made from molded plastic and frosted glass, and looks more like the real thing.

lines.text: Now glue the 2" coupling to the center of the 1½" tee, threaded side out.

lines.text: After it dries, sand the outside of both pieces.

lines.text: Apply a coat of primer to the outside, then black paint.  I suggest  multiple coats.

lines.text: Place the wireless sender inside the tee, so that the coil lies flat in the center.

lines.text: Drain the battery in the ring, then flip the switch off and place it inside the lantern.  The indicator LED should light up

lines.text: After about 15 minutes, pull it out and turn the switch on, the high-brightness green LED should light up.

lines.text: If it does, you're done! If not, flip the ring over and put it back.  If that doesn't work, check your wiring.
